Description: This auction is for an Epiphone, Sheraton II Reissue, Semi-Hollow, Electric Guitar with an Ebony finish and soft case. This guitar weighs 9.8 pounds. Serial number S931006XX. Epiphone Sheraton, for the authentic semi-hollow style and tone without breaking the bank! It comes with a sleek black finish over a maple body and neck, rosewood fingerboard with pearl and abalone inlays, dual humbucking pickups, an ABR-1 bridge, gold hardware and tuners. Body Material: Laminated Maple with Mahogany Center Block Neck: Hard Maple, Slim Taper "C" Profile, Glued-In Scale: 24.75" Nut Width: 1.68" Fingerboard: Rosewood with Block & Triangle Mother of Pearl and Abalone Inlays Fingerboard Radius: 12" Pickups: Alnico Classic™ Humbuckers Controls: 2-Volume, 2-Tone, 3-Way Toggle Binding: Multi-Headstock, Multi-Neck. Multi-Body Frets: 22, Medium-Jumbo Bridge: LockTone™ Tune-o-matic/Stopbar Hardware: Gold Pickguard: Bound "Tortoise" with Metal "E" Machine Heads: Wilkinson™ 14:1 This guitar is in good condition. It has a couple scratches and dings on the top, some worms on the back and a few scuffs on the headstock. There's also some scratching on the pick guard. It is also stamped on the back of the headstock with a "USED", most likely a factory 2nd or a refurb. Can't tell for sure. Serialized 311557683. Weighs 8 pounds 7 ounces. No case included. Epiphone Sheraton, for the authentic semi-hollow style and tone without breaking the bank! It comes with a sleek black finish over a maple body and neck, rosewood fingerboard with pearl and abalone inlays, dual humbucking pickups, an ABR-1 bridge, gold hardware and tuners. The Epiphone Sheraton II is a contemporary reissue of the Sheraton, laminated maple top, back, and sides, two f-holes, set three-piece maple neck, 20-fret bound rosewood fingerboard with white pearl block and triangle inlays, bound floral headstock, design with three-per-side tuners, tune-o-matic bridge, stop tailpiece, raised tortoise pickguard with E logo, two covered humbucker pickups, four knobs (two volume, two tone), three-way switch, gold hardware and an Ebony finish. The Epiphone Sheraton II was introduced in 1986 The Sheraton II became much more popular than the original. Epiphone's high end guitars, the elitist line, includes a Sheraton. Unlike the "regular" line Sheraton with its full-size Gibson-style humbuckers, it features the New York mini humbuckers of the original Sheraton (later used on several Gibsons, but originally an Epiphone-specific transducer). Currently original Sheratons are rare, but Sheraton II's are still in production and are readily available. PRODUCT FEATURES Beautiful binding and Abalone inlay Gold hardware Alnico Classic Humbuckers SPECIFICATIONS Body Material Laminated maple with mahogany center block Neck 5-piece Hard Maple/Walnut, Slim Taper “C” Profile, Glued-in Dimensions 24.75” scale Nut width 1.68” Fingerboard rosewood w/"block and triangle" inlays; Mother of Pearl and Abalone Fingerboard radius 12” Neck Pickup Alnico Classic Humbucker Bridge Pickup Alnico Classic Humbucker Controls 2-Volume, 2-Tone Binding Multi-Headstock, Multi-Neck, Multi-Body Frets 22 medium jumbo Bridge Gold Locktone Tune-o-matic StopBar bridge Hardware Gold Pickguard Bound "Tortoise" Pickguard with "E" logo Used, good condition, minor fret wear, some wear to the gold plated hardware. Checked and tested. Ohio residents must add 7.5% sales tax. Buyer pays shipping. PayPal, MC and VISA accepted. OH PB Lic. #100051 S
Title: Epiphone Sheraton II Reissue Semi-Hollow Electric Guitar Ebony
